revised_title: Distribution Patterns of Three Helicid Snail Species in Derbyshire Limestone District
tldr: This study investigates the distribution patterns of three helicid snail species, Gepaea nemoralis, G. hortensis, and Arianta arbustorum, in the limestone district of Derbyshire. The research finds that A. arbustorum is more common in wetter habitats, while G. nemoralis tends to increase in areas with less plant cover. The authors also note that humidity plays a significant role in the distribution of these species, with G. hortensis favoring wetter habitats. The study provides insights into the factors influencing the distribution of these snail species in their natural environment.
